Test Cases.Title: Homepage Navigation and Functionality
Test Cases.Objective: Verify the functionality and responsiveness of the top navigation bar and key homepage sections.

Step 1.Action: Open the Amazon.com homepage in a browser.
Step 1.Expected Result: The Amazon homepage loads successfully, displaying all elements as described in the screenshot.

Step 2.Action: Click on different navigation options (e.g., 'Today's Deals', 'Customer Service', 'Account & Lists').
Step 2.Expected Result: The corresponding pages load correctly, and the navigation bar remains functional throughout the process.

Step 3.Expected Result: The dropdown menu with all categories appears, allowing users to browse different product categories.

Test Cases.Title: Homepage Section Verification
Test Cases.Objective: Verify that all product sections on the homepage are displayed correctly and contain expected information.

Step 1.Action: Observe the 'Pick up where you left off', 'Shop for your home essentials', 'Get your game on', and 'Top categories in Kitchen appliances' sections.
Step 1.Expected Result: Each section is visible, displays relevant product images and descriptions, and loads without errors.

Step 2.Action: Click on any product displayed in the sections.
Step 2.Expected Result: The page navigates to the corresponding product page, displaying the selected item details and related information.

Step 3.Action: Verify the shopping cart icon and its count.
Step 3.Expected Result: The cart icon displays the correct number of items currently present in the cart.

Test Cases.Title: User Location and Site Switching
Test Cases.Objective: Verify that the user location is correctly displayed and that switching between .com and .in sites functions correctly.

Step 1.Expected Result: The location is accurately reflected as 'Pune 411005, India'.

Step 2.Action: Locate and click on the message prompting the user to switch to the .in site for local delivery.
Step 2.Expected Result: The page redirects the user to the corresponding Amazon.in site.

Step 3.Action: Verify that the account information in the top right corner is correctly displayed.
Step 3.Expected Result: The user's name, 'Sanskruti', or relevant account identifier is visible.

Test Cases.Objective: To verify the search functionality within the Amazon India app.

Step 1.Expected Result: The Amazon India app home screen loads successfully.

Step 2.Expected Result: The search bar displays 'laptop' and shows relevant search suggestions below.

Step 3.Expected Result: The app displays search results related to 'laptop stand'.
